meanings.definition: Make (someone) feel less confident or frightened.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder unnerved the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected noise unnerved the audience.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse unnerved the big, tough cat.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence unnerved the detective as he entered the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind unnerved the weary travelers on their journey.

meanings.definition: Cause to lose courage or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The challenging task unnerved the young student.
meanings.sent2: The failure unnerved him, but he didn't give up.
meanings.sent3: The silly joke unnerved the serious professor during the lecture.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected setback unnerved her momentarily, but she quickly regained her composure.
meanings.sent5: The steep mountain trail unnerved the inexperienced hiker.
